result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric M Stevens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric M Stevens in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Eric M Stevens.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests a motion hearing. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Eric M Stevens in court.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 10-10-2022 at 08:30 AM, Branch 13
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant.($500.00) LW
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.

Defendant Eric M Stevens not in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Eric M Stevens.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for motion hearing/calendar call.
Defendant called the Court at 9:55 a.m. notifying the Court he would appear by 11:00 a.m.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.   Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing and calendar call in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed; State's Response to Defense Motion to Suppress.

Defendant Eric M Stevens in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: MK.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requested motion hearing date.  Defense motion to be filed on or before 5/27/22. State's response to be filed on or before 6/13/22.  Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Eric M Stevens in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric M Stevens appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the location 8720 North Deerwood Drive.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/27/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Eric M Stevens in court.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/25/22 @ 1:30p
